thread.title: Can Cardinals' Wacha recapture postseason magic?
thread.title_full: Can Cardinals' Wacha recapture postseason magic?

title: Can Cardinals' Wacha recapture postseason magic?
text:
Michael Wacha #52 of the St. Louis Cardinals reacts after walkin a Chicago Cubs batter during the fourth inning against the Chicago Cubs at Wrigley Field Saturday. ST. LOUIS, Mo. - 
For a guy who earned the tag of postseason hero two years ago, Michael Wacha isn't exactly inspiring a whole lot of confidence these days. 
That's what allowing 43 baserunners and 21 runs over 24 innings in September will do. But the St. Louis Cardinals will call on Wacha in a critical Game 3 of the National League Division Series on Monday against the Chicago Cubs and 22-game winner Jake Arrieta. 
One man who's willing to bet on Wacha is a guy who knows something about pitching: Adam Wainwright, the staff ace who just returned to active duty last week after a torn Achilles had sidelined him for just over five months. 
"I think his highs far outweigh his lows," said Wainwright, speaking before the Cardinals' 6-3 loss Saturday. "He was one of the biggest pieces of getting us to the World Series in 2013. He's got great stuff. We have tremendous confidence in Michael." 
Whether it's because his rhythm was thrown off by skipping a start or because his command has gone the way of the four winds, Wacha pitched to a 7.88 ERA in September, reaching six innings just once. 
St. Louis has to hope a new month means the old Wacha. 
Copyright 2015, Schurz Communications
